definition: to finish (a letter, a painting) at a stroke
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning

sentences.english: All that King Goll crap that he had on, he's tossing it off.
sentences.chinese: 以前关于郭尔王的那一套，他是一挥而就的。

sentences.english: Some people can easily produce everything they know on a test.
sentences.chinese: 如若做一份考卷，熟悉相关知识的人可以一挥而就。

sentences.english: It is impossible to have your paper successfully written the very first time.
sentences.chinese: 成功的论文无法一挥而就。

to write a flawless essay in one go (idiom)/to be quick-witted and skilled at writing compositions
to scribble rapidly
to put pen to paper/pen mark
to write freely/to express oneself as one pleases
to write or draw with a brush/to put pen to paper/to write
to put pen to paper
to write elegantly
improvisation
to appear vividly on paper (idiom); to show forth vividly (in writing, painting etc)/to stand out markedly
pen and ink/words/writing
remuneration for literary or artistic work
writing brush/CL:枝[zhi1],管[guan3]
